page.title: 12EBURNE SCHOOL WORK 3
page.content: The area has many links with coal mining. An old wooden post erected along Deedmore Road is a former gate post of the railway link between the Coventry canal and the Alexander coal mine. The mine is now closed and much of the surrounding land is reclaimed. A farm is situated on the site of the former mine. The playing fields of Eburne school are grassed slag heaps and a bridle path is a reclaimed distributory canal trench. This lies behind Eburne school. In the school hall one can see a collage mural depicting the area in 1880. This was made by the parents. The area has no remaining contact with the mining industry and many adults living in the area are unemployed. 26% of all tenants housed in Wood End have no job.
